conclusion: Consider forces on child-pillow system and ball, considering guide rail angle and rope tension.
Ball slides along groove without friction.
Component of gravitational force on ball is \( m_1 g \sin \alpha \).
Total mass of child and pillow is \( m_1 + m_2 \).
Gravitational force on child-pillow system is \( (m_1 + m_2) g \).
Tension in rope transmits force from ball to child-pillow system.
Equation of motion for ball: \( T = m_1 g \sin \alpha \).
Force exerted by pillow on child: \( F_{\text{pillow on child}} = (m_1 + m_2) g \sin \alpha \).
Tension in rope equals gravitational force component on ball.
Force by pillow on child is total force pulling system down slope.
Calculate ratio: \( \frac{T}{F_{\text{pillow on child}}} = \frac{m_1 g \sin \alpha}{(m_1 + m_2) g \sin \alpha} = \frac{m_1}{m_1 + m_2} \).
